results.title: France panorama. [No. 71/28]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. News flashes: the Grand Prix - the season’s main racing event on the Longchamp Hippodrome. 2. The atom and Europe - the “Gargamelle” bubble chamber at the CERN in Geneva. 3. The Proust centenary - Exhibition at the Jacquemard-Andre Museum in honour of the great author Marcel Proust. 4. The Strasbourg Festival - the Strasbourg Music Festival, with Yehudi Menuhin.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 71/05]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Sport - rugby union - France vs Scotland. 2. Professional training - Metal Industry and Association of Training and Perfecting of Industrial Personnel has opened its 6th Youth and Adult Training center in the Paris region, where young men are taught metalcraft. 3. Science in the service of mankind - French scientists have just invented the world’s first nuclear cardiac pacemaker. 4. The arts - the country’s most ancient museum founded in 1694 on a donation from a Benedictine Convent, has recently been renovated - interior arrangement by Luis Michel. It houses an extensive art collection including the George and Adele Besson collection which includes work by Picasso, Desnoyer, Lohte and Matisse.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70?/??]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. After the cease fire - international meeting. 2. Saint Marie de la Mere - gypsy pilgrimage to pay homage to two Saints, at this seaside town. 3. Mark Chagall - biography, including painting of Paris opera ceiling. 4. School of the sea - one-month long school to learn “the craft of the seaman”. For boys. 5. Saving the Masais - Detailing restoration of the historic Parisian quarter. 6. The French Patrol - Air force squadron. One of world’s best aerial acrobatic teams.

results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. The laser and industry - industrial applications of French lasers, machine tools, data-processing, magnetic passports, and public works. 2. The arts - the “Beaudin” Exhibition at the Grand Palais.
